greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write 2n - 1 as p + q + r with p <= q <= r and p, q, r, p^2 + q^2 + r^2 all prime.
comment: This conjecture is stronger than the weak Goldbach conjecture. It has been verified for n up to 500,000. Those 0<n<1715 with a(n)=0 are 1, 2, 3, 5, 10, 46, 126, 129, 154, 201, 385, 426, 475, 1714.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Nov 05 2012
